N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 375.5 - Wage continuance plans

State Regulations
(a) Arrangements for wage continuance during disability, in effect on April 13, 1949, may be accepted as an existing plan, provided such plan formed part of
the employer's regular contract of hiring, either under written agreement or by
established custom and practice. (b) A wage continuance plan in effect on

April 13, 1949, but not then under written agreement, may be accepted as a plan
if it is reduced to a written agreement and proof satisfactory to the chairman
is submitted that the plan was actually in existence on April 13, 1949, as the
employer's established custom and practice. Notes
